Detailed Description

Internal functions used to implement the public facing API in qubits.h.

Do not call these functions directly. In general, qubits_env_local.c and qubits_env_mpi.c will implement the public API by choosing the correct function or combination of functions to use from those included here.

Definition in file qubits_internal.h.

Function Documentation

void controlPhaseGate ( const int  numQubits,
const int  idQubit1,
const int  idQubit2,
double *restrict  stateVecReal,
double *restrict  stateVecImag 
)

Implement the control phase (the two qubit phase gate).

REWRITE TO USE MULTIQUBIT input: // numQubits -- number of qubits // idQubit1, -- specified qubits // idQubit2 // stateVecReal, -- real/imag parts of // stateVecImag the state vector //

output: // stateVecReal, -- real/imag parts of // stateVecImag the state vector (overwritten) //

00751                         bit3 = extractBit (idQubit3, index);
00752                         if ((bit1 && bit2 && bit3)) {
00753                                 stateVecReal[index]=0;
00754                                 stateVecImag [index]=0;
00755                         }else{
00756                                 stateVecReal[index] *= myNorm;
00757                                 stateVecImag[index] *= myNorm;
00758                         }
00759                 }
00760         }
00761         return probOfFilter;
00762 }

double findProbabilityOfZeroDistributed ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  measureQubit 
)

Measure the probability of a specified qubit being in the zero state.

Size of regions to skip is a multiple of chunkSize.

Parameters:
[in] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits to be initialised
[in] measureQubit qubit to measure
Returns:
probability of qubit measureQubit being zero

void rotateQubitDistributed ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  rotQubit,
Complex  rot1,
Complex  rot2,
ComplexArray  stateVecUp,
ComplexArray  stateVecLo,
ComplexArray  stateVecOut 
)

Rotate a single qubit in the state vector of probability amplitudes, given the angle rotation arguments, and a subset of the state vector with upper and lower block values stored seperately.

Remarks:
Qubits are zero-based and the the first qubit is the rightmost
Parameters:
[in,out] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits to be initialised
[in] rotQubit qubit to rotate
[in] rot1 rotation angle
[in] rot2 rotation angle
[in] stateVecUp probability amplitudes in upper half of a block
[in] stateVecLo probability amplitudes in lower half of a block
[out] stateVecOut array section to update (will correspond to either the lower or upper half of a block)

References ComplexArray::imag, Complex::imag, MultiQubit::numAmps, MultiQubit::numQubits, ComplexArray::real, and Complex::real.

Referenced by rotateQubit().

00279         stateImagUp,stateImagLo;                             // (used in updates)
00280         // ----- temp variables
00281         long long int thisTask;                                   // task based approach for expose loop with small granularity
00282         const long long int numTasks=multiQubit.numAmps;
00283 
00284         // (good for shared memory parallelism)
00285 
00286         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00287         //            tests                                                 //
00288         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00289         assert (rotQubit >= 0 && rotQubit < multiQubit.numQubits);
00290

00296         // --- task-based shared-memory parallel implementation
00297         //
00298         double rot1Real=rot1.real, rot1Imag=rot1.imag;
00299         double rot2Real=rot2.real, rot2Imag=rot2.imag;
00300         double *stateVecRealUp=stateVecUp.real, *stateVecImagUp=stateVecUp.imag;
00301         double *stateVecRealLo=stateVecLo.real, *stateVecImagLo=stateVecLo.imag;
00302         double *stateVecRealOut=stateVecOut.real, *stateVecImagOut=stateVecOut.imag;
00303 
00304 # ifdef _OPENMP
00305 # pragma omp parallel \
00306         default  (none) \
00307         shared   (stateVecRealUp,stateVecImagUp,stateVecRealLo,stateVecImagLo,stateVecRealOut,stateVecImagOut, \
00308                         rot1Real,rot1Imag, rot2Real,rot2Imag) \
00309         private  (thisTask,stateRealUp,stateImagUp,stateRealLo,stateImagLo)
00310 # endif
00311         {
00312 # ifdef _OPENMP
00313                 # pragma omp for schedule (static)
00314 # endif
00315                 for (thisTask=0; thisTask<numTasks; thisTask++) {
00316                         // store current state vector values in temp variables
00317                         stateRealUp = stateVecRealUp[thisTask];
00318                         stateImagUp = stateVecImagUp[thisTask];
00319 
00320                         stateRealLo = stateVecRealLo[thisTask];
00321                         stateImagLo = stateVecImagLo[thisTask];
00322 
00323                         // state[indexUp] = alpha * state[indexUp] - conj(beta)  * state[indexLo]
00324                         stateVecRealOut[thisTask] = rot1Real*stateRealUp - rot1Imag*stateImagUp + rot2Real*stateRealLo + rot2Imag*stateImagLo;
00325                         stateVecImagOut[thisTask] = rot1Real*stateImagUp + rot1Imag*stateRealUp + rot2Real*stateImagLo - rot2Imag*stateRealLo;
00326                 } // end for loop
00327         }
00328 } // end of function definition

void rotateQubitLocal ( MultiQubit  multiQubit,
const int  rotQubit,
Complex  alpha,
Complex  beta 
)

Rotate a single qubit in the state vector of probability amplitudes, given the angle rotation arguments.

alphaRe = cos(angle1) * cos(angle2)
alphaIm = cos(angle1) * sin(angle2)
betaRe = sin(angle1) * cos(angle3)
betaIm = sin(angle1) * sin(angle3)

Remarks:
Qubits are zero-based and the the first qubit is the rightmost
Parameters:
[in,out] multiQubit object representing the set of qubits to be initialised
[in] rotQubit qubit to rotate
[in] alpha rotation angle
[in] beta rotation angle

00185                  stateImagUp,stateImagLo;                             // (used in updates)
00186         // ----- temp variables
00187         long long int thisTask;                                   // task based approach for expose loop with small granularity
00188         const long long int numTasks=multiQubit.numAmps>>1;
00189         // (good for shared memory parallelism)
00190 
00191 
00192         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00193         //            tests                                                 //
00194         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00195         assert (rotQubit >= 0 && rotQubit < multiQubit.numQubits);
00196 
00197 
00198         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00199         //            dimensions                                            //
00200         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00201         sizeHalfBlock = 1LL << rotQubit;                               // size of blocks halved
00202         sizeBlock     = 2LL * sizeHalfBlock;                           // size of blocks
00203 
00204 
00205         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00206         //            rotate                                                //
00207         // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
00208 
00209         //
00210         // --- task-based shared-memory parallel implementation
00211         //
00212         
00213         // Can't use multiQubit.stateVec as a private OMP var
00214         double *stateVecReal = multiQubit.stateVec.real;
00215         double *stateVecImag = multiQubit.stateVec.imag;
00216         double alphaImag=alpha.imag, alphaReal=alpha.real;
00217         double betaImag=beta.imag, betaReal=beta.real;
00218 
00219 # ifdef _OPENMP
00220 # pragma omp parallel \
00221         default  (none) \
00222         shared   (sizeBlock,sizeHalfBlock, stateVecReal,stateVecImag, alphaReal,alphaImag, betaReal,betaImag) \
00223         private  (thisTask,thisBlock ,indexUp,indexLo, stateRealUp,stateImagUp,stateRealLo,stateImagLo) 
00224 # endif
00225         {
00226 # ifdef _OPENMP
00227                 # pragma omp for schedule (static)
00228 # endif
00229                 for (thisTask=0; thisTask<numTasks; thisTask++) {
00230 
00231                         thisBlock   = thisTask / sizeHalfBlock;
00232                         indexUp     = thisBlock*sizeBlock + thisTask%sizeHalfBlock;
00233                         indexLo     = indexUp + sizeHalfBlock;
00234 
00235                         // store current state vector values in temp variables
00236                         stateRealUp = stateVecReal[indexUp];
00237                         stateImagUp = stateVecImag[indexUp];
00238 
00239                         stateRealLo = stateVecReal[indexLo];
00240                         stateImagLo = stateVecImag[indexLo];
00241 
00242                         // state[indexUp] = alpha * state[indexUp] - conj(beta)  * state[indexLo]
00243                         stateVecReal[indexUp] = alphaReal*stateRealUp - alphaImag*stateImagUp - betaReal*stateRealLo - betaImag*stateImagLo;
00244                         stateVecImag[indexUp] = alphaReal*stateImagUp + alphaImag*stateRealUp - betaReal*stateImagLo + betaImag*stateRealLo;
00245 
00246                         // state[indexLo] = beta  * state[indexUp] + conj(alpha) * state[indexLo]
00247                         stateVecReal[indexLo] = betaReal*stateRealUp - betaImag*stateImagUp + alphaReal*stateRealLo + alphaImag*stateImagLo;
00248                         stateVecImag[indexLo] = betaReal*stateImagUp + betaImag*stateRealUp + alphaReal*stateImagLo - alphaImag*stateRealLo;
00249                 } // end for loop
00250         }
00251 
00252 } // end of function definition

Generated on 6 Apr 2017 for Distributed QUEST by  1.6.1
